channel.name: Together TV UK
channel.title: Edwardian Farm
channel.desc: Two archaeologists and a historian try Edwardian life for a year. They prepare for the arrival of their first livestock, and historian Ruth Goodman cooks a sheep's head stew.

channel.name: Together TV UK
channel.title: Country Show Cook Off
channel.desc: Chef Theo Randall and cook Rachel Allen compete in the Atholl and Breadalbane Agricultural show, and sample award-winning honey from the Heather Hills honey farm.

channel.name: Together TV UK
channel.title: Scotland's Greatest Escape
channel.desc: A fun-loving family of four judge treehouses at Lanrick, a secluded, hand-crafted cabin near Loch Lomond and a campsite on a remote Hebridean island.

channel.name: Together TV UK
channel.title: Garden Rescue
channel.desc: Charlie and Lee are in Corby to design a global garden with a nod to both Sid's Asian heritage and Dan's northern European background.

channel.name: Together TV UK
channel.title: The Stick Up
channel.desc: In this period caper, set in 1930s England, romance blooms between two very different people, an American thief and an Irish woman.

channel.name: Together TV UK
channel.title: Can You Keep It Up For A Week?
channel.desc: Comedy. Annette will marry Gil, her hapless boyfriend, on the condition he keeps his new job for a week without getting up to mischief with other women. Contains sexual scenes.

channel.name: Together TV UK
channel.title: Death Race 2000
channel.desc: Action classic. A brutal car race requires contestants to run down pedestrians as they view for victory. Stars Sylvester Stallone and David Carradine. Contains nudity and violence.

channel.name: Together TV UK
channel.title: Real Thick Glasses
channel.desc: Solomon Watkins' quirky take as he interviews Michael, owner of the world's most unique collection of Really Thick Glasses. Funded and supported by Together TV and Cat Flap Media.

channel.desc: Darcey begins her royal road trip at the Highland Games in Balmoral, before sampling royal whisky and attempting a dance at the Ghillies Ball.

channel.desc: Charlie Dimmock and Flo Headlam are in Pershore to create Adrian and Jenny's dream woodland garden with a gothic twist.

channel.desc: Michelin-starred chef Theo Randall and cook Rachel Allen compete in the Bute Agricultural Society's summer show, sample world-renowned oysters and make a quiche.

channel.desc: Chef Theo Randall and cook Rachel Allen compete in the Atholl and Breadalbane Agricultural show, and sample award-winning honey from the Heather Hills honey farm.
